name: (1R)-3-Oxoindane-1-carboxylic acid
Reason: 1R-3-oxoindane-1-carboxylic acid has a melting point of 100.5°C. The carboxylic acid functional group is a strong withdrawing group, which increases the melting point by approximately +20°C. The presence of a methyl group on the alkyl chain also contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C. The indane ring itself has a melting point of around 106°C, which is influenced by the steric hindrance and conjugation of the ring.
